body.p: A study seeks to answer the question, “Does Vitamin C level in the breast milk of new mothers reduce the risk of allergies in their breastfed infants?” The study concluded that high levels of vitamin C (measured in mg) were associated with a 30 percent lower risk of allergies in the infants.
In this scenario, “levels of vitamin C (measured in milligrams)” is what type of variable?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A categorical variable classifies subjects into one of several categories.
Correct. Level of vitamin C is a quantitative variable that takes on a value in milligrams.

body.p: A study seeks to answer the question, “Does Vitamin C level in the breast milk of new mothers reduce the risk of allergies in their breastfed infants?” The study concluded that high levels of vitamin C (measured in milligrams) were associated with a 30 percent lower risk of allergies in the infants.
In this scenario, “presence of allergies” is what type of variable?

response.feedback: Correct. Presence of allergies (yes or no) is a categorical variable.
Incorrect. A quantitative variable must take on a numerical value. In this case, presence of allergies is classified into two categories: yes or no.
